intro: Pelonastes, commonly known as the desert orchid, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, drought-resistant growth habit. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming during the rainy season. Its roots are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Pelonastes plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing sandy soils.
